conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the metal rod MN and the resistance value of R2.
The Ampere force F acting on the rod is given by F = BIL.
B is the magnetic field strength, I is the current through the rod, L is the length of the rod in the magnetic field.
Given B = 0.6 T, L = 15 cm = 0.15 m.
The gravitational force component along the incline is F_g = mg sin(30°).
Since the rod is stationary, F = F_g, thus BIL = 0.085.
The total resistance R_total in the circuit is given by R_total = R1 + R2 + r.
Using Ohm's Law: I = E / R_total, 0.944 = 10 / R_total, R_total = 10 / 0.944 ≈ 10.6 Ω.
The magnitude of the Ampere force is approximately 0.1 N.
The resistance value of R2 is approximately 6 Ω.
